intro: Caelestina scabriuscula, commonly known as the roughleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Its leaves are rough to the touch, giving it its common name, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Caelestina scabriuscula is often found in shaded environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
